WritableStreamDefaultWriterAbort.summary:
The abort() method of the
interface aborts the stream, signaling that
the producer can no longer successfully write to the stream and it is to be immediately
moved to an error state, with any queued writes discarded.

remarks.para:
If the writer is active, the abort() method behaves the same as that for
the associated stream (). If not, it returns a
rejected promise.

WritableStreamDefaultWriterAbort.returns:
A , which fulfills with the value given in the reason
parameter.
